huffmancoding

Class HuffmanCompression

  • java.lang.Object
    • huffmancoding.HuffmanCompression

  • public class HuffmanCompression
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that compresses the file with Huffman's Code algorithm.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HuffmanCompression() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      HashMap<java.lang.Character,java.lang.Integer> addFrequencies(java.lang.String originalFile)
      Method that adds character frequencies in the original file to HashMap.
      void compressText(java.lang.String originalFile, java.io.FileOutputStream fos, HashMap<java.lang.Character,java.lang.Integer> frequencies)
      First this method starts method that writes frequencies at start of the file, then it reads original file as inputstream and uses writeFile method to compress the data one char time.
      java.io.FileOutputStream createOutput(java.lang.String originalFile)
      Method that uses original file to make name for new file and returns FileOutputStream for writing the new file.
      HashMap<java.lang.Character,java.lang.String> getcharToCode()
      Getter used for testing, might get removed later.
      void readTree(Node node, java.lang.String code)
      Method that is used for creating the code for each character in original text.
      void run(java.lang.String originalFile)
      The main method of compressor.
      void writeFile(BinaryOutput bo, char c)
      Writes the output file with help charToCode and use of BinaryOutput class.
      void writeFrequenciesToFile(HashMap<java.lang.Character,java.lang.Integer> frequencies, BinaryOutput bo)
      Method that writes symbols and its frequencies to output file.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run(java.lang.String originalFile)
         throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                java.io.IOException
        The main method of compressor. Starts all other methods needed for data compression.
        Parameters:
        originalFile - String the original file which will be compressed.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
        java.io.IOException

      • createOutput

        public java.io.FileOutputStream createOutput(java.lang.String originalFile)
                                      throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Method that uses original file to make name for new file and returns FileOutputStream for writing the new file.
        Parameters:
        originalFile - String, the original file.
        Returns:
        fos FileOutputStream, used for output.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

      • addFrequencies

        public HashMap<java.lang.Character,java.lang.Integer> addFrequencies(java.lang.String originalFile)
                                                              throws java.io.IOException
        Method that adds character frequencies in the original file to HashMap.
        Parameters:
        originalFile - String, the Original file.
        Returns:
        frequencies HashMap, contains symbols and their frequencies.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • readTree

        public void readTree(Node node,
                     java.lang.String code)
        Method that is used for creating the code for each character in original text. It creates the code by traveling recursively in the tree.
        Parameters:
        node - current node, starting in the root.
        code - current code, starting with empty string.

      • writeFrequenciesToFile

        public void writeFrequenciesToFile(HashMap<java.lang.Character,java.lang.Integer> frequencies,
                                   BinaryOutput bo)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Method that writes symbols and its frequencies to output file. Symbol $ is used to mark the end of frequencies and the real compressed data begins after it.
        Parameters:
        frequencies - HashMap, contains symbols and their frequencies.
        bo - BinaryOutput, used for writing symbols and their frequencies into file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • compressText

        public void compressText(java.lang.String originalFile,
                         java.io.FileOutputStream fos,
                         HashMap<java.lang.Character,java.lang.Integer> frequencies)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        First this method starts method that writes frequencies at start of the file, then it reads original file as inputstream and uses writeFile method to compress the data one char time. Symbol £ is used to mark the end of compression.
        Parameters:
        originalFile - String, the original file.
        fos - FileOutputStream, used for output.
        frequencies - HashMap, contains symbols and their frequencies.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • writeFile

        public void writeFile(BinaryOutput bo,
                      char c)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the output file with help charToCode and use of BinaryOutput class.
        Parameters:
        bo - BinaryOutput
        c - char that is currently being compressed and written into file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getcharToCode

        public HashMap<java.lang.Character,java.lang.String> getcharToCode()
        Getter used for testing, might get removed later.
        Returns:
        charToCode HashMap
